title: Vagrant 1.8.1 - A parameter cannot be found that matches parameter name 'Generation'
body:
### Vagrant version

1.8.1
### Host operating system

Windows 8
### Provider

hyperv

I get the following error during vagrant up, my Vagrantfile is a standard vagrant init hashicorp/precise64.

``` ruby
An error occurred while executing a PowerShell script. This error
is shown below. Please read the error message and see if this is
a configuration error with your system. If it is not, then please
report a bug.

Script: import_vm.ps1
Error:

C:\HashiCorp\Vagrant\embedded\gems\gems\vagrant-1.8.1\plugins\providers\hyperv\scripts\import_vm.ps1 : A parameter
cannot be found that matches parameter name 'Generation'.
At line:1 char:1
+ &('C:\HashiCorp\Vagrant\embedded\gems\gems\vagrant-1.8.1\plugins\providers\hyper ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidArgument: (:) [import_vm.ps1], ParameterBindingException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : NamedParameterNotFound,import_vm.ps1
```

I was able to resolve the issue quickly by commenting out line 110 in import_vm.ps1

```
$vm_params = @{
    Name = $vm_name
    #Generation = $generation
    NoVHD = $True
    MemoryStartupBytes = $MemoryStartupBytes
    SwitchName = $switchname
    BootDevice = $bootdevice
    ErrorAction = "Stop"
}
```

Looks like a similar issue was resolved before by lucasjans and it relates to Windows 6,2 New-VM API
https://github.com/paulshir/coreos-hyperv/issues/1
